#How to integrate gwt-dialogs library into a Maven project

= Repository =
If you use Maven to build you project (what i personnaly recommend) you can easily set you project with gwt-dialogs by adding the following dependency to your pom.xml:

<dependency>
        <groupId>com.tinesoft.gwt-dialogs</groupId>
        <artifactId>gwt-dialogs-library</artifactId>
        <version>1.0.0</version>
</dependency>
The dependency is published on Sonatype maven repository. So you must add the following reposition in you repositories section:

For release versions of the library:

<repository>
        <id>sonatype.snapshots</id>
        <name>Sonatype snapshot repository</name>
        <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/</url>  
        <layout>default</layout>
</repository>
For snapshot versions of the library:

<repository>
        <id>sonatype.release</id>
        <name>Sonatype release repository</name>
        <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/release/</url>
        <layout>default</layout>
</repository>
